page.title: 14Old Buildings Mickleton
page.content: The CHURCH was begun in the reign of Henry II and enlarged in the 14th C. The OLDEST DWELLING,known as Cosycote, is 14th C.MICKLETON MANOR HOUSE is 15th C.Part of the grounds have been sold for building.MEDFORD HOUSE,17th C was a neglected farmhouse,then occupied by an architect who restored it,but added a red-brick wing(1930's). Some old cottages remain,some with thatched roofs.Any buildings of a certain age or architectural note are known as listed buildings.One of these the KINGS ARMS INN,has 17th C origins, was a coaching inn,and housed the village tailor in the late 19th C. TUDOR HOUSE dates partly from the 16th C.ADMINGTON MANOR HOUSE,c.1550,is shown on the Barcheston Tapestries and has a Medieval Dovecote.MEON HALL is in part an early building.
